channel.title: Corb Lund Band
channel.description:
Who here likes Corb Lund Band? It's country music(here me out:) but the good kind :)
It's a bunch of sweet tunes, banjo's and everything. Download the song The truck got stuck, and tell me what you think ;) The songs usually tell a story or adventure, and they are really catchy. Go listen to "the truck got stuck" :)
[br][size=1]Posted at: April 24, 2006, 04:22:46 pm[/size][hr]Nobody likes it :(

item.title: Corb Lund Band
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:6, topic:2052”]Died from impact or later on?

I like Johnny

I fell in, to a burning ring of fire.
I went down down down, and the flames grew higher.[/quote]

He passed out on impact, was legally dead for a few minutes. Ambulence came, somehow revived him, he then died over night from severe brain damage. This guy was in his 20’s, and the guy who hit him didnt go to jail, I still dont understand why. The guy who hit him is named Josh Brash, he’s well known as a criminal in our town yet he never goes to jail for anymore then a night. After he got hit with a baseball bat, my friends uncle took a round with him, and still kicked his ass after being hit with the bat a few times. We were all very drunk, and was one hell of a crazy night, but not very fun

I searched google to see if there was an article, hoping our local newspaper would have published it on the net but I could not find. I still dont know everything that happened that night, but it was all caused because when they opened up the truck door they hit that Josh guys car very slightly(not even a dent).

Just goes to show that small towns can be just as dangerous as a large city. Siver’s I can still remember that sound the baseball bat made. Sounded so hollow.

Read full topic

Died from impact or later on?

I like Johnny

I went down down down, and the flames grew higher.

item.title: Corb Lund Band
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I do not like country for the most part, theres just a few of them that are pretty cool. I suppose my choice of music is also influenced by my friends. I listen to al lot of music, except rap and death metal. When we do our mud runs we listen to this kind of music, even some Johnny Cash as well

Mud Runs are whenever we get like 20 people and we race trucks through paths we made in the forest, we do it usually when its extremely muddy. I only drove once, and feaked out a little too much(Im only 15). Last year someone died though, my friends sisters boyfriend’s friend(rofl) got hit over the head by a baseball bat, I’ll never forget that aweful sound.

Read full topic

item.title: Corb Lund Band
item.dc:creator: @Got_Shine Got_Shine
item.description:
@Got_Shine wrote:

Yeah, on my bus to school every morning my driver plays the weakest country. I usually just listen to my psp but sometimes I forget it.

Read full topic

item.title: Corb Lund Band
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I used to like it, but I was forced to listen to it :-/

I can’t think of one USA concert Reba McIntire(sp) has done that I haven’t been too and been backstage -_-

I can deal with some Martina McBride, Clay Walker, Travis Tritt, Garth Brooks. But the new country is lame and is starting to get too sexual.

Read full topic

item.title: Corb Lund Band
item.dc:creator: @Got_Shine Got_Shine
item.description:
@Got_Shine wrote:

No offense, I just can’t stand country. The twangs and crap are just so irritating. I’m sure I’d like it if I got into it a bit and started listening.
